text: Alright, I bumped into the edge of my knowledge of the system and I'm going to recommend that if this persists that you open a support ticket.
Great question, I also wonder this. I did find that you can currently access this through the property list component
When running `hs project dev` I'm not seeing the "Developing locally" tag. This is on a production account.
I'm not getting to the step `Browser connected and listening for bundle updates`
are you a super admin?
Hmm, partner admin
yeah I ran into this same issue last week, unfortunately it looks like this isn't supported right now
pretty annoying, what I did was just created another dev account and ran my dev cards in there
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C05R599UA12/p1711116043772119>
Oh? Was this a recent change? I developed this custom card over a month ago without this issue
<@U04EJHVD8FM> would probably be able to speak to that
its not a recent change <@U06ALUC4HMZ>
Ok, thanks for the info. Will def. need a work around.
The dev tools are only available for super admins for now. <@U06ALUC4HMZ> can you please confirm your exact role in the account?
<@U01AHCQ7EJC> What did you see when you copy the trace ID and check the log trace in this scenario?
Can you tell me more about this?
Like a file drop upload component in crm cards
Ah thanks. I miss the connection with new file property, though.

Oh I was just wondering since HubSpot added a file type property to make it even easier to manage attachments, and added a file drop component in HubSpot forms… I thought that all the base functionality was there to add those features easily into the CRM cards

Oh okay, so you are referring to file property public beta. As Carter mentioned, you can use property list to add files directly. And you can either create this card through UI or use the property list component inside your custom card. This is to attach files to the object.
Ohhh that’s cool, that works pretty well I think

Now coming to generic file upload component, we have discussed that for sometime, however, there are some limitations today that we will be working through. A lot of it also depends on your file size too, and there are cases when you will run into timeout. Most of the use cases that I've seen relate to being able to attach file to the record, where developers used notes before. Property List is a great way to solve it.
Yeah, I'm a Partner Admin
I was informed by the client that my role was changed (there was an email/notification sent by HubSpot regarding Partner Roles), so I'm guessing that was the issue.
Currently attempting to transfer my JSON based card to react and i am seeing this error:
But this is what my log traces page looks like:
Though I have updated my platform version for this build:
I managed to fix my error but i still dont see log traces

<@U06ALUC4HMZ> was the client sent an email or communication saying that partner admins were given CRM dev tool access? I'm curious if they were under the impression that the partner admin role changed to include this.

Or was the email just to you letting you know that your role changed in the portal? (e.g. from super admin to partner admin) It could be that the client didn't realize removing the SA would remove CRM dev tool access :thinking_face:

That said, we're finishing up work on the developer permission set, which will allow SA's to grant non-SA users access to CRM development tools.

Client was sent the email/communication - I'm not sure on the details. I don't think they were aware of the reduction in feature access. It's definitely more appropriate for me to have the Partner Admin, but since we work on their Custom Cards that power to grant access is critical. We can make due in the meantime.
Figured it out, i incorrectly updated the hs cli so my global hs was using the old command
